msContents.summary: Accouncement of death sent respectively to the village scribe and the scribes of the metropolis by relatives of the deceased person. Follows the same general formula as that of similar documents already published. (Grenfell and Hunt)

msItemStruct.note: Text is on one side only, 25 lines written with the fibers. Text mentions the village of Euhemeria "in the division of Themistes."
Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology collection

supportDesc.support: 8.3 x 28.7cm. Wormholes throughout. Top, left, and bottom margins more or less intact.

provenance.p: Excavated by Grenfell and Hunt (1898-9) on behalf of the Egyptian Exploration Fund, and donated to the University Museum in return for its support (1901, Dr. Parrish Collection).

div.ab: To Heraclides, village-scribe of Euhemeria, from Mysthes, son of Peneouris, of Euhemeria in the division of Themistes. My brother Peneouris, registered as an inhabitant of the neighborhood of the said village, has died in the month of Mesore of the first year of Gaius Caesar Augustus Germanicus. I therefore present to you this notice in order that his name may be placed upon the list of deceased persons, according to custom. (signed) Mysthes, son of Peneouris, aged forty-two years, having a scar on the right fore-arm. Date and counter-signature. (Grenfell and Hunt)
